data.title: The Ultimate Scout Jamboree Packing List
data.preview_text: To make the most of a Scout Jamboree, preparation is key. Whether you're a seasoned Scout or a first-time camper, having the right gear and essentials is crucial for an enjoyable experience! World Scouting brings you "The Ultimate Scout Camp Packing List" - a comprehensive guide to help you pack everything you need for a fantastic camp adventure!
data.author: World Scouting

data.title: One step closer to comfort
data.preview_text: Krzysztof is a 23-year-old Scout leader in Warsaw. He joined the Polish Scouting and Guiding Association when he was nine years old and has been active in Scouting ever since.
data.author: European Scout Region
data.tags: UAct, Europe, Scouting and Humanitarian Action

data.title: Scouting - the sandbox of life
data.preview_text: Someone at my Wood badge course told us that the average volunteering time within our organisation is 8 years. I'm currently at 9. As Scouting is primarily focused on youth, there is often a sense of urgency to achieve and experience as much as possible before it's considered "too late." But what does that really mean?
data.author: European Scout Region

data.title: Celebrating Lord Michael Baden-Powell's life and contributions
data.preview_text: The global Scout community is deeply saddened by the recent passing of Lord Michael Baden-Powell, grandson of the Founder of Scouting, Lord Robert Baden-Powell, who has Gone Home peacefully on 3 July 2023 at the age of 82.
data.author: World Scouting
data.tags: World Scouting, Communications and Scouting Profile, History, Adults in Scouting, nation

data.title: 8 things to know before the World Scout Jamboree
data.preview_text: Heading to the World Scout Jamboree? This guide provides key tips from a seasoned Scout who has been to Jamborees in Japan, South Korea and the United States! Scout Leaders, be prepared for an incredible adventure at the 25th World Scout Jamboree!
data.author: World Scouting

data.title: Empowering Arab Youth for a Sustainable Future
data.preview_text: The Arab Scout Region participated in the Regional Consultation Forum for Adolescents and YouthICPD@30 in Tunisia, organized by UNFPA and strategic partners. This pivotal event aimed to shape a sustainable future by empowering the young generation, and the Arab Scout volunteers played a crucial role in this endeavour.
data.author: World Scouting

data.title: "The hug 2023" a day of unity, environmental awareness and inclusion.
data.preview_text: In Rio de Janeiro, a crowd of enthusiastic volunteers, including more than two hundred Scouts, joined in an inspiring day of cleaning up the beaches, followed by an emotional symbolic hug known as "Aquele Abraço" ("That Hug"). ) on the beach of São Conrado.
data.author: Interamerican Scout Region

data.title: Ticket to Life Manila’s 2nd Eagle Scout becomes a finalist in the search for Outstanding Scouts
data.preview_text: John Jazper Luna is an 18-year-old Eagle Scout from Manila, Philippines. Inspired by his brother in his younger years, he started Scouting through Ticket to Life (TTL).
data.author: Asia-Pacific Scout Region

data.title: Youth-led Humanitarian Action takes centre stage at the WeAct Forum
data.preview_text: The World Organization of the Scout Movement (WOSM) concludes the five-day WeAct Forum, which brought together over 150 Scouts and representatives from humanitarian organisations this week in Krakow, Poland.
data.author: European Scout Region
data.tags: UAct, Humanitarian Crisis, Scouting and Humanitarian Action

data.title: Youth share their community impact projects at ExpoPro 2023
data.preview_text: On May 6, 54 young scouts full of passion and commitment belonging to 12 countries and cultures of the Interamerican Scout Region participated as exhibitors in the first Expo of Community Projects “ExpoPro”.
data.author: Interamerican Scout Region

data.title: Over 150 participants from big youth organisations join forces to mobilise youth in Asia-Pacific
data.preview_text: Joined by over 150 participants across 22 countries, big youth organisations will collaborate and work together towards community projects and engage the youth in their organisations.
data.author: nbolandrina
data.tags: Partners, Sustainable Development Goals, Youth Empowerment

data.title: Scout Camp in a Refugee Camp: How Scouting is Helping in Malawi
data.preview_text: Just outside of Malawi’s bustling capital of Lilongwe, Scout leaders and the Scout Association of Malawi are working together to create a sense of community and offer Scouting activities to hundreds of children and youth living in the Dzaleka refugee camp.
data.author: World Scouting

data.title: Sudanese Scouts building peace amidst conflict
data.preview_text: Following the outbreak of armed conflict in early May, Scouting in Sudan offers a beacon of hope and solidarity, providing assistance and support to affected communities. As a Movement based on volunteerism and duty towards others, Scouts are peace advocates playing a crucial role in crisis response, peacebuilding, and citizen protection.
data.author: World Scouting

data.title: Arab Parajamboree sets the bar for hosting inclusive Scout events
data.preview_text: Imagine a place where diversity is celebrated, inclusion is the norm, and barriers are broken down. This is exactly what the second Arab Scout Inclusive Camp (Parajamboree) was all about. From 29 April to 5 May 2023, Scouts from Arab countries came together in Morocco for an event that showcased the power of Scouting to create a more inclusive world.
data.author: World Scouting

data.title: From Fundraisers to Advocates: Norwegian Guides and Scouts Transform Lives of Young Refugees
data.preview_text: When the camera starts filming, young Scouts and Guides welcome Crown Prince Haakon and Crown Princess Mette-Marit to a campfire at Øvresetertjern in Nordmarka (Norway).
data.author: European Scout Region

data.title: My journey of discovering humanity in crisis and service
data.preview_text: Veronika is a 21-year-old Scout in Slovakia. She became active in community service actions during the COVID-19 pandemic when Slovakian Scouts led response efforts like delivering face masks and respirators.
data.author: European Scout Region
data.tags: Scouting and Humanitarian Action, Europe, UAct

data.title: Inspira a otros con Earth Tribe 2023
data.preview_text:
El desafío es comenzar la conversación sobre la Tribu de la Tierra en tus escuelas, comunidades e iglesias.

La idea es sensibilizar a otros jóvenes con datos reales sobre lo que está pasando a nuestro Planeta Tierra y cómo cada uno puede colaborar uniéndose a la Tribu de la Tierra.
data.author: susana.salguero.silva

data.title: Inspire others with Earth Tribe 2023
data.preview_text:
We are challenging you today to start the conversation about Earth Tribe in your Schools, communities and churches. 

The idea is to sensibilize other young people with real data about what is happening now to Earth and how they will be able to collaborate by joining Earth Tribe.
data.author: susana.salguero.silva

data.title: World Scouting and EU meet to discuss youth and the SDGs
data.preview_text: Ahmad Alhendawi, Secretary General of WOSM and Jutta Urpilainen, European Commission Directorate for International Partnerships, met to discuss the challenges facing young people around the world and Scouting’s role in supporting the European Commission in delivering on their global development priorities.
data.author: World Scouting

data.title: Scouts Canada overcoming stigmas to strengthen child and youth safety
data.preview_text: For more than 100 years, Scouts Canada has given millions of young people unique and enriching experiences towards developing important skills and values, encouraging them to be curious, adventurous, and responsible members of society.
data.author: World Scouting

data.title: Candidates for Coordinators of the Interamerican Youth Network 2023
data.preview_text: 2 Coordinators for the Interamerican Youth Network will be elected for the period between the  Networks meeting in 2023, until the first network meeting after the Interamerican Scout Conference in 2026.
data.author: susana.salguero.silva

data.title: National Scout Jamboree 2023: Czechia's Largest Gathering of Scouts Since 1931
data.preview_text: The National Scout Jamboree 2023 is the largest gathering of scouts in the Czech Republic since 1931. This event brings together 5,000 boys and girls aged 10-16, over 550 adult and teenage volunteers, and a large organisational team.
data.author: European Scout Region

data.title: Over 60 Rovers gather for 14th WOSM Agora focused on sustainability and empowering youth
data.preview_text: The 14th WOSM Agora, which took place in National Scout Centre of Fátima (Portugal) from April 12-16, saw more than 60 rovers from 21 countries representing 24 National Scout Associations coming together for four intensive days of an event 'for Rovers, by Rovers'.
data.author: European Scout Region
data.tags: Europe, For youth by youth, Youth Empowerment, Rovers, Earth Tribe Europe

data.title: Scouts support King Charles III's Coronation at Westminster Abbey
data.preview_text: 14-25 year old Scouts and volunteers made their way to Westminster Abbey to coordinate and support the Coronation, where HRH King Charles III was officially crowned on May 6, 2023.
data.author: European Scout Region

data.title: Explore the new Scout Donation Platform!
data.preview_text: Today, World Scouting - WOSM and the World Scout Foundation are thrilled to announce the launch of a brand new Scout Donation Platform as a dedicated space for Scouts to fundraise for community improvement projects in the areas of environment, peace, health, life skills and Scouting.
data.author: World Scouting

data.title: From Scouting to community building: Czech Scouts ease the integration of Ukrainians at Prague community centre
data.preview_text: After being a Scout for most of her life, 25-year-old Mája joined World Scouting and UNICEF’s UAct project in 2022 to work closely with Ukrainians who fled to her country, Czechia.
data.author: European Scout Region

data.title: Young People Called to Innovate as the first Africa Rover Moot Opens
data.preview_text: “I recognize the importance of the Scout movement as a partner in advancing the development of young people. The movement is a social force that can be harnessed for good in areas such as peace and security, climate action and international integration,” said Hon. Ababu Namwamba EGH, Cabinet Secretary, Ministry of Youth Affairs, Sports and the Arts
data.author: Nelson Opany

data.title: Scout makes 3D printer prosthetic limbs in Mexico
data.preview_text: Mariana Elizalde Cano, a 23-year-old Scout from Mexico, became a Messenger of Peace Hero in 2021 in recognition of her remarkable work in producing and donating over 160 prosthetic arms across Mexico using her home 3D printer.
data.author: World Scouting

data.title: Scouts Commemorate Earth Hour with Call for Urgent Climate Action
data.preview_text: Scouts across Africa joined WWF in commemorating Earth Hour by organizing in-person and virtual awareness events, conducting marches for nature, planting trees, conducting environmental clean-ups, and doing the symbolic switch-off at 08:30 PM local time on 25 March, while calling for urgent action on climate change.
data.author: Nelson Opany

data.title: Interreligious Symposium Unites Scouting in the Central African Republic
data.preview_text: The three-day first Africa Scout Interreligious Symposium held in Bangui, Central Africa Republic from 17-19 March 2023 brought together 57 Scout leaders, government representatives and partners of Scouting from 8 countries with a call for unity and togetherness for peace and the well-being of society.
data.author: Nelson Opany

data.title: 3.6 Million People Supported through 2 Years of Global Youth Mobilization
data.preview_text: Since its launch in December 2020, the Global Youth Mobilization has financed projects directly engaging over 600, 000 young people in developing and implementing activities reaching over 3.63 million community beneficiaries.
data.author: World Scouting

data.title: World Scouting gravely concerned by IPCC’s final warning on climate crisis
data.preview_text: Earlier this week, the world’s leading scientists released a sobering report via the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC). While World Scouting is increasing efforts to advocate, educate and act to help put the planet on a path to sustainability, we call on all to prioritise climate action and nature-based solutions before it’s too late.
data.author: World Scouting

data.title: Scouts Mobilise to Support Cyclone Freddy Emergency Response
data.preview_text: Scouts of Madagascar working in collaboration with the State and humanitarian NGOs are providing the much-needed support. They established and deployed a First Aid Brigade of 100 Scouts in the city of Antananarivo in collaboration with the Fire Brigade, led blood donation drives, and helped repair homes damaged by the cyclone.
data.author: Nelson Opany

data.title: Scouts Challenged to Innovate for a Sustainable Future at the Africa Scout Day Celebrations
data.preview_text: Hundreds of Scouts from 20 countries from Africa and Europe joined by a host of guests and partners gathered to celebrate the Scout Movement’s efforts in the areas of education and moulding of young people, training of adults and implementation of transformative community development activities during the 2023 Africa Scout Day celebrations in Nairobi.
data.author: Nelson Opany

data.title: World Scout Centre celebrates 100 years
data.preview_text: Celebrations to mark 100 years of the Kandersteg International Scout Centre have gotten off to an incredible start with almost 200 Scouts and Guides from 53 different countries attending events in the lead up to a summer of festivities.
data.author: World Scouting
data.tags: KISC, Events, Kandersteg International Scout Centre, Scout Centers of Excellence for Nature and the Environment

data.title: Inspiring the next generation: Belgian Scouts leading the way in Human Rights Education
data.preview_text: Les Scouts have taken the lead in human rights education. As part of their #IMPACT plan in 2019, the organisation initiated a campaign to raise awareness about human rights, in collaboration with UNICEF Belgium, Amnesty International Belgique, and Délégué général aux droits de l’enfant.
data.author: European Scout Region
data.tags: Human Rights, Education for Human Rights

data.title: WOSM showcases non-formal education, health, wellbeing at WHO Youth Council meeting
data.preview_text: WOSM highlighted the importance of non-formal education in promoting good health and wellbeing at the inaugural meeting of the World Health Organization’s Youth Council in Geneva, Switzerland.
data.author: World Scouting
data.tags: Partnerships, Youth Action, World Health Organisation, Health

data.title: How Anna realised that happiness can be found even in  the darkest of times
data.preview_text: Anna is a 20-year-old Scout leader from Dnipro, Ukraine. She fled Ukraine when the war escalated in February 2022, but she returned to Dnipro as soon as it was safe to do so. Having faced displacement, Anna volunteers with internally displaced children who fled to Dnipro from war-affected cities like Mariupol and Sievierodonetsk.
data.author: European Scout Region
data.tags: UAct, Europe, Eurasia, Scouting and Humanitarian Action

data.title: Empowering and Transforming Scouting activities with Pathfinder Scouts Vietnam Youth Forum 2023
data.preview_text: Following the success of the first event 3 years ago, the 2nd Pathfinder Scouts Vietnam National Youth Scout Forum was held in Ho Chi Minh City on 3-5 February 2023, gathering more than 100 young potential Scout Leaders & Rovers from all units across the country.
data.author: Asia-Pacific Scout Region

data.title: 10,000+ Scouts Gather for 32nd Asia-Pacific and 11th National Scout Jamboree in Bangladesh
data.preview_text: Bangladesh Scouts hosted the 32nd Asia-Pacific and 11th National Scout Jamboree, which took place from 19th to 27th January 2023 at the National Scout Training Centre, Mouchak, Gazipur.
data.author: Asia-Pacific Scout Region

data.title: One Year On: Scouts Continue to Support Ukrainians Displaced by War
data.preview_text: One year ago, the full-scale war in Ukraine forced millions to leave their lives behind in search of safety elsewhere. Over 8 million refugees have now fled Ukraine, and an additional 6 million people have been internally displaced within the country.
data.author: European Scout Region
data.tags: Scouting and Humanitarian Action, Europe, Eurasia

data.title: New WOSM Youth Representatives ready to advocate for global issues
data.preview_text: Eleven new Youth Representatives have been selected to represent World Scouting internationally and advocate for causes that matter to young people and communities.
data.author: World Scouting
data.tags: Youth Representative, Sustainable Development Goals, Advocacy, Partnerships, Youth Engagement

data.title: Can Scouting help migrants and refugees? How Chilean Scouts are doing it
data.preview_text: Community service and compassion are key values in Scouting. Showing determination to help others, Scouts in Chile - the Asociación de Guías y Scouts de Chile - created a program for migrants to provide recreational activities that lead to more harmonious inclusion of migrant children and youth through Scouting.
data.author: World Scouting

data.title: Scouts of Brazil Conduct Unprecedented Cruise along the Brazilian Coast
data.preview_text: The Scouts of Brazil began an unprecedented expedition this Tuesday, February 14th. For the first time in the institution’s history, a team of three volunteer sailors from the Scout Movement will sail along the Brazilian coast in a vessel donated by the Federal Courts and the Brazilian Navy.
data.author: Interamerican Scout Region

data.title: Periods matter: How Finnish and Ugandan Scouts are breaking menstrual taboos
data.preview_text: In Uganda, girls do not enjoy the same level of freedom and equity as boys. UNESCO estimates that one in ten girls in Sub-Saharan Africa misses a week of school every month due to their periods, fuelling inequity between girls and boys both at school and on a larger scale.
data.author: European Scout Region
data.tags: Europe, Gender Equality, Africa, Inclusion, Youth Empowerment

data.title: Scouts' tree-planting initiative aids wildfire recovery from Croatia to North Macedonia
data.preview_text: Forests play an essential role in combating climate change and biodiversity loss. Our forests serve as carbon sinks and help reduce the effects of climate change.
data.author: European Scout Region

data.title: World Scouting supports relief efforts after deadly Türkiye and Syria earthquakes
data.preview_text: In the early morning on 6 February 2023, powerful earthquakes shook southeast Türkiye and northern Syria resulting in thousands of casualties and injuries after the earthquake levelled buildings and devastated communities.
data.author: World Scouting
data.tags: Humanitarian, Humanitarian Crisis, Earthquake, Europe, Arab

data.title: Empowering more than 1,000 Romanian youth to promote Agenda 2030
data.preview_text: The level of information, responsibility, and active participation (both at the community level and during the decision-making process) towards stopping global warming and reducing its effects is currently insufficient in Romania.
data.author: European Scout Region
data.tags: Education for Sustainable Development, Sustainable Development Goals, Youth Empowerment

data.title: “Scouting gives young people the confidence to be themselves”
data.preview_text: Lana is a 20-year-old Scout (tabornica) from Slovenia. At the age of 16, she became the leader of the organising team for ZOT (Zimsko Orientacijsko Tekmovanje), a Slovenian national Scout competition held annually on the last weekend of January, attended by approximately 300 Scouts from across the country (aged 11 upwards).
data.author: European Scout Region
data.tags: Europe, Skills and Activities, Values and Lifeskills
